definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: pollute, defile, profane;

definitions.title: Hiph.
definitions.body: also begin (lit. untie, loosen, open, v. Arab.) (Ar. h.al=a untie, undo, become free, lawful, free from obligation or tie; IV. make lawful; x. esteem lawful or free, profane, desecrate, violate; NH [[חלל]] be profane, desecrated (also Pi. Hiph. transit.), cf. Aram. [[חֲלַל]] h.alel Pa. is purify, 0ah.el Aph. is profane)—
reflex. pollute, defile oneself

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: ritually, by contact with dead ‖[[טמא]], Le 21:4 (H).

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: sexually ‖[[זנה]] Le 21:9 (H).
Pass., be polluted, defiled, of holy places Ez Eze 7:24, Eze 25:3, name of God Ez Eze 20:9, Eze 20:14, Eze 20:22, Is 48:11 and even God himself Ez Eze 22:16, Eze 22:26.
defile, pollute:

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: sexually, Ge 49:4 (poem) = 1Ch 5:1 (the father's bed); a woman = [[זנה]] Le 19:29, Le 21:9 (H); [[זַרְעוֹ]] Le 21:15 (H).

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: ceremonially, profane, the altar by a tool Ex 20:25 (JE); sacred places Le 21:12, Le 21:23 (H), Ez Eze 7:21, Eze 7:22, Eze 7:22, Eze 23:39, Eze 24:21, Eze 44:7, Zep 3:4, Mal 2:11, Ps 74:7, Da 11:31; the holy land Je 16:18; sacred things Le 19:8, Le 22:9, Le 22:15 (H) Nu 18:32 (P) Ez Eze 22:26; the sabbath Ex 31:14 (P), Is 56:2, Is 56:6, Ez Eze 20:13, Eze 20:16, Eze 20:21, Eze 20:24, Eze 22:8, Eze 23:38, Ne 13:17, Ne 13:18; and so the sanctity of the prince of Tyre who made himself God, and his holy places, Ez Eze 28:7, Eze 28:16, Eze 28:18.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: the name of God Le 18:21, Le 19:12, Le 20:3, Le 21:6, Le 22:2, Le 22:32 (all H), Am 2:7, Je 34:16, Ez Eze 20:39, Eze 36:20, Eze 36:21, Eze 36:22, Eze 36:23, Mal 1:12, God himself Ez Eze 13:19.

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: ´[[י]] defiles or profanes his inheritance by giving it over to Babylon Is 47:6; the princes of the sanctuary by giving them to Chaldeans Is 43:28.
violate the honour of, dishonour, ´[[י]] subj. crown of Davidic kingdom Ps 89:40 (sq. [[לארץ]] pregn.), kingdom of Judah La 2:2; the [[גאון בל חבי]] Is 23:9.
violate a covenant Ps 55:21, Ps 89:35, Mal 2:10, the [[חקות]] of God Ps 89:32.
treat a vineyard as common (v. [[חׂל]]) by beginning to use its fruit De 20:6, De 20:6, De 28:30, Je 31:5 (v. the law Le 19:23–Le 19:25, H).

definitions.title: Pu.
definitions.body: Pt. [[בַּגּוֹיִם שְׁמִי הַגׇּדוֹל הַמְַחֻלָּל]] Ez Eze 36:23 my great name which is profaned among the nations.

definitions.title: Hiph. 1. a.
definitions.body: Impf. [[אֶת־שֶׁם־קָדְשִׁי עוֹד לאׁ אַחֵל]] Ez Eze 39:7 I will not let my holy name be profaned any more.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: [[לאׁ יַחֵל דְּבָרוֹ]] he shall not violate his word Nu 30:3 (P).

definitions.title: Hoph.
definitions.body: Pf. ´[[אׇז הוּחַל לִקְראׁ בְּשֵׁם י]] then it was begun (= men began) to call on the name of ´[[י]] Ge 4:26 (J).

definitions.title: Def
definitions.body: Note.—[[וַיׇּחֵלּוּ מְעַט מִמַּשָּׂא]] Ho 8:10 begin to be minished by reason of the burden RV Hi al.; Wü Now rd. [[וְיׇחִלוּ]] (I. [[חול]], [[חיל]])—for om. of dagh. v. also [[וְיׇחֵלוּ]] of Cod. Bab.—shall be in anguish a little for the burden, so Ra AV; Ew [[וְיׇחִלוּ]] that they may wait (?) a little; LXX [[וחדלו מעט ממשׁח]] cease a little from anointing, so Che We, this probably best.
